intro: Lecanthus wightii, commonly known as the Indian starfruit or carambola, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruit. The plant produces small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. The fruit is typically five-lobed, with a sweet, acidic flavor when ripe. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and edible fruit.
